snippet: A California TV station and the National Transportation Safety Board apologized after an anchor reported bogus names of the pilots of Asiana Airlines Flight 214 based on information from a board intern.
abstract: San Francisco Bay Area television station and National Transportation Safety Board apologize after station reports bogus names for pilots on board the Asiana Airlines flight that crashed in San Francisco International Airport.
lead_paragraph: A California TV station and the National Transportation Safety Board apologized after an anchor reported bogus names of the pilots of Asiana Airlines Flight 214 based on information from a board intern.

headline.main: Station That Erred in Report on Plane Crash Apologizes
headline.print_headline: After Erring on Pilots’ Names Amid Crash, Two Apologies
